column1: * AWS Pricing Calculator provides only an estimate of your AWS fees and doesn't include any taxes that might apply. Your actual fees depend on a variety of factors, including your actual usage of AWS services.
Conversion of t3.2xlarge instances from "On demand" to "Convertible reserved instances". With this update it is possible to save a part through the commitment to keep the resource in use for 1 year.
Downgrading EC2 instances from m4.10xlarge to m4.4xlarge and changing the type from "On demand" to "Convertible reserved instances". In this way
column2: we can opt for a slightly less powerful processing
column3: but with a lower price and good performance. As it is of the "Convertible reserved instances" type
column4: it can be changed over time to accompany the growth of the product.
